root: ^For as long as you can remember, you've been poor as fuck. There's no work, no money to be had really. A difficult life, to say the least. So, like most fictional characters in this situation, you find yourself resorting to thievery. You've gotten pretty good at it.
^Of course, from there, you have to find a motivation, don't you?

getRich: ^Okay, yeah, get rich, that makes sense. Good, clear, though not very moral and a bit thin. Right? Like narratively. But no matter, you can't change who you are.
CHANGE: ^Ah I see. We're Robin hood now. How exciting.

^In your quest to aid those below you, you've decided the best place to hit would be a bank. Not a small one, the biggest bank in the country. Where interest rates are high, and loans are never paid off. Unless you're rich already, those people have great relationships with this bank. A perfect symbol.
^So, it's time to end some debt. Let's go destroy some Loan Documentation
loanDocumentation: ^Alright, in a bid to end any legally binding paperwork and lift the crushing debt off of as many people as possible, you scout out the biggest bank in the nation. Now the best way into the server room would be to pose as IT. Now, to really pull this off, because this bank is full of assholes, you're going to have to look the part. Think you can handle that?
sure: ^The server room was in need of updating, and you waited until after they had contacted an IT department. It wasn't hard to figure out how and when that happened, you've been watching this bank for some time now.
^You pose as an IT guy, and you make your way to the server room. The guy who led you there though, seems to want to watch what you're doing. How do you fix that?
^Ask if he can go find me some made up chord name and work fast
^Ask about his life. Ya got kids?
chordName: ^You ask him to go find you a JR-76 data string, and when he looks at you confused you look back like he's an idiot.
^Eager to not be an idiot, he pretends he knows what you're talking about and hurries out. That should buy you a long while to get to work.
wellFuck: ^So you did all the casing of this place and never learned about servers?
uh: ^You spend so long stalling and trying different things, that the guy comes back and catches you, and since you look as dumb as he feels, you get caught.
^Remember kids, do ALL the research first
damnRight: ^Okay first of all, chill. Second of all, I said it's good and clear so there's no need to get aggressive.

^So, in your pursuit of getting rich, you've decided to go for the largest mansion in your operating area. The big time. There's plenty of security. You know, big dudes, big weapons, traps and plenty of monitoring going on. All that fun stuff.

^From your own previous scouting, there's two entrances, two possibilities. A basement door around the side of the house, under the guard-tower balcony, or a window in the lord's room, 4 stories up, with only a set of vines to it.
window: ^Intruder window? What a choice. Unfortunately, the lord doesn't sleep often, and is in his room when you get there, his wife asleep on the bed. You do have some luck though, his back is to you, and he seems very intent on something. You have some time.
^To your left is the Lord's robes, with a rather sturdy looking belt. To your right is a shield of the lord's house, heavy.
strangle: ^Woaaaahhhhhhh okay we're violent tonight huh? Why'd you do that?
^So he doesn't catch me. Less witnesses.
lessWitnesses: ^Okay then. Well uh...on with the show I guess?
^So you manage to make your way down the hall without being spotted. You are, again, a master thief, and you kept the rope, so as you go you just fucking strangle whoever gets in your way I guess.
^Finally, you make your way to the vault. A heavy, locked, black door with no obvious opening or handle blocking your path to that sweet, sweet moolah.
^Now the question is of course, how to open the door?
^try to smash it in with my shoulder
smash: ^Well that was fucking dumb wasn't it? You make such a loud noise after breaking your shoulder on this giant metal door that you alert a guard, who shows up and runs you through.
idiot: ^Okay then. Well uh...on with the show I guess?
^So you manage to make your way down the hall without being spotted. You are, again, a master thief, and you kept the rope, so as you go you just fucking strangle whoever gets in your way I guess.
^Finally, you make your way to the vault. A heavy, locked, black door with no obvious opening or handle blocking your path to that sweet, sweet moolah.
^Now the question is of course, how to open the door?
^try to smash it in with my shoulder
inspectMore: ^You slide your hands along the door, and what do you know? A secret latch the same color as this really dark metal door. In a dark room. Huzzah.
^You grab onto the latch and pull with all your might. With a way too loud screech, the metal slides along the floor. Inside, there's...nothing.

^Before you can really ponder your current predicament, it seems the screeching door has attracted attention, and you can hear guard's boots coming down the hall. If they catch you, they will kill you.
hide: ^You find yourself trapped in the vault, the door somehow swinging shut behind you. It's pitch black here, the kind of dark that feels palpable. And you are alone. Once the door shuts, all sound from the outside is gone. No light, no sound, just you. Only you.

^You search for a while, trying to find something good in here, some gold. As time goes on, you look for a light. Then a way out. You find none of them. Could you have avoided this? You're not even sure where the door is anymore. Is this your punishment? You've circled the room hundreds of times, dragging your hand along the wall, and you must be going mad. It just isn't there.
^Slowly, you become too weak. Slowly you stop moving. Slowly, you stop breathing.
dweeb: ^Ok hey, fuck you, tech is cool.
iSaid: ^You try to sneak your way in, there's an unlocked window nearby. But the security in this building is super high tech, real insane stuff. Stuff you don't even know how to deal with yet, and it catches you pretty instantaneously.
^The cops are there within minutes, and you're arrested and convicted.
gotKids: ^He looks at you confused, blinking like that one meme where he tilts his head slightly.
howOld: ^"Three and seven." And like any good parent, once you get him going, he just rants on and on and on about his kids.
listen: ^You get so wrapped up in the conversation that the guard's boss comes to tell you both that the bank is closing and you're forced to leave. The real tech guy is coming the next day so you won't be able to try again.
^I mean technically you failed, but you made Steve the guard feel validated.
didntThink: ^You think about it for a minute, knowing you don't no shit about software, but you realize...you do know hardware.
^And a server will still go down if it's physically destroyed. Some backups will be on someone's hard drive here, but this is the main storage.
^You grab something without looking and start smashing.
^Which happens to be that guys water bottle.
^And now the building is on fire, holy fuck.
OHSHIT: ^Well it certainly destroyed the servers. However, you are also in that room...
^Most people get out okay, but the fire grows and grows until all of a sudden everything is destroyed. The server, the backups, you definitely succeeded.
^They find you late that night, among the rubble. At least you died doing something good. Thousands of people's loan debt, just gone. You did good, even if you did good in a rather stupid way.
basement: ^There's a crack in the foundation where it meets the ground, just enough for a person to wiggle through if you can dig a bit for it. Luckily, a small hand shovel works. You've had to move around the guard rotations, but lucky for you there's no such thing as electric lighting yet, so no search lights!
^You wiggle your way down and end up on a beam above the basement, where a few guards are patrolling in a square pattern, going in opposite directions.
^Try to balance and move along the beams.
^Drop down and try to sneak down on the floor.
balance: ^Smart. You wiggle down the beams, keeping low so as not to be seen, trying to keep your footsteps quiet, and eventually you find yourself standing above the entrance to the hallway, where a guard is standing outside, and you still have the guards below you, but they seem to be engaged in a conversation at the other end of the hall, backs turned. Lucky you.
^Drop down and try to get by the guard.
getByGuard: ^You silently drop behind him. So far so good, but the guard is blocking the door pretty well and you're a bit stuck now. No way around, only through, and you don't have much time.
knockHimOut: ^You manage to choke him out just enough to make him lose consciousness but not enough to kill him. You know I never understood how the guards don't notice the "ack, ack" sounds other guards make when they get choked out just because they're facing the other way. I mean, for narrative and laziness reasons, the other guards don't hear YOU but like, still.
^It doesn't make a lot of sense.
focus: ^So, you gently guide the guard to the floor and slip out into the hallway, to your right you can see another guard walking away from you down the hall. As you carefully slip down the hall, you can see an opening to another long hallway to your left, and the hall keeps going to your right. The guard is reaching the end of the main hall way around now as well.
leftHall: ^You slip into the left hall and against the wall, keeping to the shadows. I'm going to assume you're being sneaky about it, because I'm going to give you the benefit of the doubt of not being an idiot.
thanks: ^Anyway, you stick yourself to the wall and watch as the guard passes you by, allowing you to slip back out into the main hall. Don't worry there was nothing down the left hall. I'm moving you for the interest of time.

^After a bit you come to a hall on your right, and through there you see it. The vault. As you get closer, you realize it's dead set into the wall. A large, black door with no obvious opening to that sweet, sweet money.
^try to smash it in with my shoulder
fightThemOff: ^You hold your own for a little bit, but eventually they overwhelm you.
^You're a thief, not a warrior. But props for bravery.
deservedIt: ^I mean yeah, I mean lords in this century basically do take from the poor to amass their wealth right, but that's pretty universal.
^I mean I don't really care, I just tell myself they deserved so that I can sleep at night when I murder.
guillotine: ^Okay then. Well uh...on with the show I guess?
^So you manage to make your way down the hall without being spotted. You are, again, a master thief, and you kept the rope, so as you go you just fucking strangle whoever gets in your way I guess.
^Finally, you make your way to the vault. A heavy, locked, black door with no obvious opening or handle blocking your path to that sweet, sweet moolah.
^Now the question is of course, how to open the door?
^try to smash it in with my shoulder
youreRight: ^The server room was in need of updating, and you waited until after they had contacted an IT department. It wasn't hard to figure out how and when that happened, you've been watching this bank for some time now.
^You pose as an IT guy, and you make your way to the server room. The guy who led you there though, seems to want to watch what you're doing. How do you fix that?
^Ask if he can go find me some made up chord name and work fast
^Ask about his life. Ya got kids?
cool: ^He nods and things go back to awkward silence, but now he's staring at you awkwardly. Suspiciously. Good going pal.
^Eventually after a few minutes of fumbling to seem like you're doing something, he starts murmuring his suspicion into his walkie-talkie.
^Ask if he can go find me some made up chord name and work fast
shitKnockHimOut: ^You grab the nearest heavy object and knock him over the head with it. He crumples to the ground like a stone. Oof that's gotta hurt.
^His walkie talkies now blaring. "Steve? Steve what's going on? Steve?"
^Pick it up and try to imitate the guard.
everythingsFine: ^"...what? Nevermind, I'm sending someone down to check on you."
^Uh, negative negative we have a radiation leak it's really ugly down here uh...aw screw it.
negative: ^Great time to work fast. You do know how servers work right?
figureOutServers: ^After a while of pushing buttons and pulling on wires while the guard chatters on, but eventually the server lights go down and one of those dramatic mewwwwww noises old tvs make in movies pings.
technoBabble: ^You say random tech words in as cohesive an order as you can manage and Steve just looks at you.
continueTechnoBabble: ^The guard just looks more and more confused. "Well..I mean..."
^Eventually you just blurt out that it needs to rest and another tech guy will be in tomorrow, if anything goes wrong it's their fault and you leave.
^Somehow you just walk right out of there.
^Steve's so gonna lose his job, but hey! Loan Docs! Gone! Probably!
dropDown: ^Okay, you drop down and follow the guards' pattern. Sticking to the right and following them around the wall.
^Finally you get to the door on the other side where a third guard is standing with his back to you. Before you even get a chance to assess the damage, you hear a gruff "Hey!" from behind you.
caught: ^You turn and catch the guard's attention, which wasn't actually on you. He calls again and the other guards turn on you too.
fists: ^You brought your fists to a sword fight? This isn't the elder scrolls okay you can't take a sword to the chest and then punch your way out!
^And that's exactly what happens, you move to feint and punch and get a sword to the ribs.
wait: ^You wait to drop down, to see if the guard leaves. He does not, in fact the other two guards come up to chat with him.
keepWaiting: ^Wow they're talking for a while, aren't they?
^Eventually someone comes to change the guard.
^Drop down while they're changing the guard.
keepWaiting2: ^You keep waiting, and waiting, and waiting, and eventually you starve to death and become one of those skeletons who has a beard for some reason with your jaw open.
killaBitch: ^Uh I mean, you snap his neck. With your hands, you uh, you snap his neck.
^He crumples tin your arms like a stone, somehow no one hears. So, time to go. I don't know how this sort of thing works, like I get it narratively but um, how do the guards not hear? Like...what?
^It doesn't make a lot of sense.
doesntMakeSense: ^Yeah, you're right! I'm right! Okay, so the muffled noise the guard makes as you deal with his neck and you gently guide him to the ground is enough to attract the guards, who turn around and run you through.
^Thanks friend, for reminding me logic is better than an engaging experience. :)
mainHallway: ^You try to remain in the shadows as you move, but the guard turns and spots you, drawing his sword. Big oh shit.
RUN: ^You run, skid into a hallway on the right, and there it is! The vault! But the guard is hot on your tail...
imAnIdiot: ^In your idiot ways you trip over your own feet right in front of the guard.
dontCare: ^Okay then. Well uh...on with the show I guess?
^So you manage to make your way down the hall without being spotted. You are, again, a master thief, and you kept the rope, so as you go you just fucking strangle whoever gets in your way I guess.
^Finally, you make your way to the vault. A heavy, locked, black door with no obvious opening or handle blocking your path to that sweet, sweet moolah.
^Now the question is of course, how to open the door?
^try to smash it in with my shoulder
getToWork: ^Okay okay cool. You know how servers work right?
weGucci: ^I can't believe that worked. Great, time to use those servers!
run2: ^You try to run but you end up tackled to the ground by Steve, pulling you down to the ground and holding you there, calling for help on his walkie-talkie.
^Nice try. I mean at least the loan documentation is probably gone, but you're going to get quite the sentence. So...I mean, half yay?
freeze: ^You freeze, stock still and wait. Turns out the guard didn't even notice you, was just going over to talk to his friend. Good instincts! They're now having a conversation facing the other wall with their backs to you.
^Just the guard in the doorway to deal with now.
dropDownNow: ^Ok now! You drop down, and the guards immediately run you through.
^Look I gotta tie up loose ends, and you waited too long.
